sentence.Network_en: His financial situation forced him to go and teach in, improbably enough, Tulsa, Oklahoma.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的经济状况迫使他很不可思议地去了俄克拉荷马州的塔尔萨教书。

sentence.Network_en: Teachers qualified to teach in England are not accepted in Scotland and vice versa.
sentence.Network_cn: 在英格兰有教书资格的老师在苏格兰得不到认可，反之亦然。

sentence.Network_en: Men don't buy the Florence Nightingale garbage they teach in nursing school.
sentence.Network_cn: 男性不会接受护理学校传授的弗洛伦斯·南丁格尔那陈旧的一套.

entry.tran: 宣讲会，座谈会(学生、教师就某一话题举行的讨论会)
entry.def: A teach-in is a meeting, usually between students and teachers, with discussions on important and interesting topics. Teach-ins are not usually part of a formal academic course.

means.word_mean: 1. an extended session (as on a college campus) for lectures and discussion on an important and usually controversial issue
